answers.answer: Call doctors. Headache in pregnancy can be a sign of high blood pressure or preeclampsia xx

I get really bad headaches all the time. I try to drink lots of water and sometimes need to take excedrin. My doc told me to try not to take it, but also if you're in a lot of pain, that is not good for the baby either, so he said I could take it once in a while.

Call your dr! Why suffer? I had horrible migraines (so bad my speech was slurred) when I was pregnant with my 1st baby. It's OK to get help. Also being in pain for days like that raises your blood pressure. ...and stress levels! I got a shot of demerol....had to.
Yea i called and they said to take tylenol... if it gets to bad then go to the hospital. ... i didnt even go to work today...... this ***** it just wont go away....
Lots of water and try snacking on something with sugar. And Tylenol

Caffine! Drink a coke, eat fruit like grapes, watermelon, and cantaloupe, sit with your head between your knees if you can for 5-10min, wrap cold/damp cloths around your ankles, and take something for migraines. Tylenol doesn't do a thing for me. You need something with caffeine and a muscle relaxer. Good luck!

I've had a headache for over 4 weeks now. It varies in severity, but it is always kind of there. I started working half days and it has helped. Also ice cream helps me because it's cold. I usually eat a fudge sickle because they're lower calorie. My doctor gave me Tylenol with codeine but it doesn't help much so I only took it twice. Get lots of rest and fluids!
Also, see if your Dr will prescribe or give you a sample of Fioricet. I had chronic migraines before pregnancy and they helped a lot!
Wow thanks ladys i just ate some ice cream hope it helps

question: I have been having a throbbing headache forbover 24 hours now along with very dry mouth.... has any one experience this... i have been contemplating calling the dr but i feel silly calling abour a headache. .. its getting really painful tho
title: please answer
